caption:
This photograph depicts the detailed examination of an oyster using a measuring tool. Two hands are seen handling the oyster and measuring device. The oyster is partially open, revealing its internal structure. The measuring tool, which appears to be a type of caliper, is used to measure the thickness or perhaps the size of the oyster.

In the background, thereâ€™s a hint of more oysters arranged in a grid-like layout, possibly in trays of water, suggesting that the setting might be an oyster farm or a research facility involved in shellfish cultivation or study. The focus and lighting emphasize the oyster and the caliper, drawing attention to the measurement process.

Overall, the image captures a moment of scientific or agricultural examination, emphasizing precision and study in oyster cultivation.
title: Epa gulf breeze laboratory: bioassay wet lab.  Fishery biologist used calipers to measure growth of oysters that have been exposed to pesticides
